info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:37PM EDT until July 20 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND NORTHEASTERN RICHMOND COUNTIES... At 836 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles south of Biscoe, or 12 miles southeast of Troy, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ellerbe, Candor, Norman, Derby, Covington, Pekin, Sandhills Game Land and Blewett Falls Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
